title: How to Make Pempek Ada'an

steps.headline: Mix the milled cork fish, spring onion, onion, egg, salt, flavoring, and then stir well.
Add the starch and coconut milk little by little and stir well.
steps.description: Make sure you stir it well, otherwise the batter will be lumpy.

steps.headline: After the mixture becomes smooth, heat the vegetable oil.
steps.description: Make sure the oil is heated well to make cooking the batter more even.

steps.headline: Shape the dough into a circular form with the help of a spoon and then pour it into the oil that is heated.
steps.description: Continue to repeat this step till the pan is full.

steps.headline: Fry the mixture until light golden brown.
steps.description: Once the dough is golden brown in color, remove and serve.

steps.headline: Mix the garlic and the Thai pepper into a blender and then blend them.
Boil 2 glasses of water.
steps.description: When the water already hot, add the brown sugar into it and stir until the sugar is melted.

steps.headline: Add the tamarind if necessary.
steps.description: You might not like the taste or smell of the tamarind. The sauce does not require you to put tamarind for a distinguishing taste.

steps.headline: Add the Thai pepper and garlic mixture to the brown sugar water.
Stir until boiling.
steps.description: Then , after that , lift it and let stand about 5 minutes. strain it into a bowl and serve at last. You can put it in the refrigerator to store it well.

text: Making Pempek Ada’an Mix the milled cork fish, spring onion, onion, egg, salt, flavoring, and then stir well.  Add the starch and coconut milk little by little and stir well. Make sure you stir it well, otherwise the batter will be lumpy. After the mixture becomes smooth, heat the vegetable oil. Make sure the oil is heated well to make cooking the batter more even. Shape the dough into a circular form with the help of a spoon and then pour it into the oil that is heated. Continue to repeat this step till the pan is full. Fry the mixture until light golden brown. Once the dough is golden brown in color, remove and serve. Making Cuka Mix the garlic and the Thai pepper into a blender and then blend them.  Boil 2 glasses of water. When the water already hot, add the brown sugar into it and stir until the sugar is melted. Add the tamarind if necessary. You might not like the taste or smell of the tamarind. The sauce does not require you to put tamarind for a distinguishing taste. Add the Thai pepper and garlic mixture to the brown sugar water.  Add salt as needed.  Stir until boiling. Then , after that , lift it and let stand about 5 minutes. strain it into a bowl and serve at last. You can put it in the refrigerator to store it well. Finished.
